label: def-canonical-logistic-rescale-function-example
name: Canonical Logistic Rescale Function
natural_language_statement: A simple, well-behaved rescale function is defined using a scaled logistic (sigmoid) function.
description: This definition provides a second concrete example of a valid rescale function. The logistic function is a canonical choice as it is smooth, monotonic, and naturally bounded, thus satisfying the Axiom of a Well-Behaved Rescale Function.
formal_statement: The Canonical Logistic Rescale Function $g_A: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}_{>0}$ is defined as: $g_A(z) := \frac{2}{1 + e^{-z}}$
